kien.title: Kien
kien.description:
This Dutch startup is working on a modular and flexible sound system. The best way to understanding is by visiting their [Indiegogo campaign](https://indiegogo.com/projects/kien-the-first-flexible-sound-system), thanks to which they've raised more than $115,000.

I'm collaborating with them designing the speakers -mainly software but some hardware advices too- and the mobile app. I know what you're thinking, *"Do we really need an app for playing some music in our speakers? Can't we just use Spotify?"* Unlike some competitors, Kien thinks that the user of these speakers should focus on the audio and not on configuring all the music services in the app. The result is that the users will be able to use their usual apps, such as Spotify, and just open Kien's app for some configurations and cool features that we're working on such as **User Tracking Audio** and **Dynamic Sweetspot**.

![Kien features](/images/projects/kien/features.png 'Kien features').

maintoolstrap.title: Maintool Classi

articles_list.title: Disfrutar de un 'smartwatch' sin sacrificar el reloj clásico
Soon you'll be able to turn any watch into a fitness tracker
Classi, la correa que convierte en ‘inteligente’ cualquier reloj

maintoolstrap.description:
The MainTool strap transforms any regular timepiece into a smart watch while keeping the elegance of traditional brands. To achieve this, the electronics and sensors are put inside a leather or a rubber strap and allow the user to track parameters such as steps, heart rate, skin temperature and many other health variables. Those measurements are sent to a mobile phone via Bluetooth Low Energy.

My job was to develop the embedded software of the strap, including:

* Communications protocol between strap and mobile phone based on BLE standard services when possible and on custom ones if not. 

* Data acquisition for the *simple* sensors.

* Algorithms for the *complex* sensors (heart rate and pedometer): I've adapted algorithms broadly used for a low power consumption and low and noisy signal levels.  

One cool *mini-project* I've been working on was an automatic test bench for the prototypes using common robotics materials such as Arduinos, servomotors and even 3D printed parts!.

I've also been working on the [landing page](http://maintool.me), the [blog](http://blog.maintool.me) and server maintenance. During my last period in the company I was coordinating the software team.

fdm.title: Festas do Monte app

articles_list.title: Un joven crea la primera aplicación con la agenda cultural de A Guarda
Un joven guardés crea una aplicación para teléfonos que muestra la agenda cultural de la zona
As Festas do Monte 2016 no teu dispositivo Android

fdm.description:
This project was born because I wanted to learn about Android development. Instead of working on some projects that would just live inside my computer I wanted to create something useful. Every year before this popular celebration begins I try to spend some time improving the app and implementing some of the features requested by the users. I find this a good way to learn the last news of the Android's framework.

The first version of this app [was created in 2013](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.caracocha.fdm13) to promote *as Festas do Monte*, the most important event celebrated in my hometown, [A Guarda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Guarda). In 2014 I launched a new version that not only contains events during that celebration but all over the year. The events are inside a JSON file hosted in a server so I can update them without having to update the app.

Like all of my personal projects, the source code is stored in [GitHub](https://github.com/xcrespo/FDM) and everybody is welcome to contribute. Open source will make us evolve and learn faster!

femtoxat.title: FemtoXat EPS

articles_list.title: FemtoXat, un satélite único no mundo
FemtoXat, un satélite gallego único en el mundo
La Universidad prevé enviar al espacio su tercer satélite en la segunda mitad de 2015

femtoxat.description:
This was my master thesis and consisted in the design, verification and validation of an Electrical Power System from scratch of a 1/3U cubesat (a small satellite). The main problems found were the size restrictions and the use of off-the-shelf components.

The prototype designed included the Battery Charge Regulator (BCR), different voltage regulators and a board for cutting the power of part of the board when the battery voltage was below a predefined threshold.

![alt text](/images/projects/femtoxat/proto.png 'Block diagram of the prototype')

After concluding my master thesis with the maximum grade, I continued with this project together with [Yago Sánchez](https://es.linkedin.com/in/yago-s%C3%A1nchez-calvo-4b1761aa/en) developing a final complete prototype ready to fit into our small satellite.

humsat.description:
Humsat is an international educational initiative, supported by multiple international organizations such as [ESA](http://www.esa.int/ESA) and [UNOOSA](http://www.unoosa.org/oosa/index.html), for building a constellation of nano-satellites providing communication capabilities to areas without infrastructure. The first satellite demonstrator, Humsat-D, was developed in the University of Vigo, resulting in the second Galician satellite.

The spacecraft was successfully launched on November 2013 and I took part on this project as a GS operator from the MCC of the University of Vigo. This activities include Operation of the Satellite (routinely operations, experiments programming, telemetry download, etc) and the facilities maintenance (antennas calibration, rotor maintenance, etc).

3Dprinter.title: 3D printer
3Dprinter.description:
My 3D printer is one of the most popular among makers all around the world: a Prusa i3. I've built the printer with the help of a good friend -thanks [Hadri](https://twitter.com/HBalado)!- basically for satisfying my curiosity in this emerging sector. The hardest part was the first calibration because there are so many variables to take into account, specially for a telecommunications engineer.

Since then I've used the printer to create pieces for some electronics to use in my projects. In the pictures below you can see some samples such as a Raspberry Pi case and a lid for a broken multimeter I got in Ebay.

Having a 3D printer at home meant that I had to learn about some CAD software to take advantage of the potential. I chose two open source alternatives: the first one for its similarity with SolidWorks (I had some experience using it) was [FreeCAD](http://www.freecadweb.org/), and the second one was [OpenSCAD](http://www.openscad.org/) for its flexibility.
